items.title: teacode community
items.content: I created this website/community where Moroccans developers can help/support each other ðŸ’» in their learning journey ðŸš€.

items.title: the Talks
items.content: I love sharing my knowledge and experience with students, answer their questions and support them ..

items.title: teaching
items.content: I taught kids the basics of programming through creating fun games, building with tools such as scratch, code.org & legos ev3 mindstorms.

items.title: helping
items.content: I like to help other developers (not just developers) to solve their problems because it allows me to learn more, which drives me to help more (infinite loop ðŸ˜µ).

items.title: reading
items.content: Reading is one of my favorite moments, it is where I feel like I am in the company of an expert (whatever the subject of the book). Here are some recommendations: The Art of Thinking Clearly | The Richest Man in Babylon | Goals! | Eat That Frog! | 97 Things Every Programmer Should Know.

items.title: Online
items.content:
I learned a lot of things just by watching a webinar or listening to a podcast, here are some links:
Podcasts: The PHP Roundtable | The freeCodeCamp Podcast | Modern Web | Tech Jr.
Conferences: WeAreDevelopers | Google Chrome Developers | JSConf | Docker Webnaires

items.title: Contribution
items.content: I like to contribute to projects/ideas that could solve a problem, help people, in other words, bring or lead to a change.

items.title: contests
items.content: I'm not a genius but I love to participate in online contests and hackathons, here are some references: hackerrank | codeforces | codechef.

items.title: Sports
items.content: My favorite sports are football, mind games (chess, sudoku), martial arts (kung fu and taekwondo). Unfortunately, the last has not been practiced for a long time ..
